definition: double-edged sword/CL:口[kou3],把[ba3]/classifier for blows of a sword
variant of 尚方劍|尚方剑[shang4 fang1 jian4]/imperial sword (giving bearer arbitrary powers)/in fiction, Chinese version of 007's license to kill
imperial sword (giving bearer plenipotentiary powers)/imperial Chinese version of 007 licensed to kill

sentences.english: Qi is the sword of man of practice.
sentences.chinese: 修行人的精气就是他的宝剑。

sentences.english: My sword fell into the river at this marked place.
sentences.chinese: 我的宝剑是从这个刻着记号的地方掉下去的。

sentences.english: He went to strike at the hedge, but where his sword met the thorns, great roses bloomed instead.
sentences.chinese: 他开始披荆斩棘，但是他宝剑所到之处都开出了蔷薇。
我拿到了匈奴王的宝剑。

sentences.english: His left hand, which rested on his enamelled sword hilt, was bandaged.
sentences.chinese: 他那按在宝剑珐琅柄上的左手外面裹着绷带。

sentences.english: What if he gets the sword and stops hitting the bull's-eye?
sentences.chinese: 怕的是得到了宝剑，就射不中靶心了。

sentences.english: Bao Jianfeng from sharpening out, plum blossom from the bitter cold.
sentences.chinese: 宝剑锋从磨砺出，梅花喷鼻自苦寒来。
高举闪着凯旋的宝剑刀锋。

sentences.english: Take ARTHURS SWORD stuck on the ground next to him.
sentences.chinese: 以亚法斯宝剑停留在他旁边的地上。

sentences.english: God and pull down the strongholds.
sentences.chinese: 然后用神话语的宝剑攻破这些营垒。

sentences.english: The enactment of this regulation gives us discretionary power.
sentences.chinese: 这个法规的颁布，犹如给我们配备了上方宝剑。

sentences.english: Yet the sword was their one, indispensable weapon against the Horcruxes.
sentences.chinese: 然而，宝剑是他们对付魂器时必不可少的武器。

sentences.english: Shaolin sword rich tradition of national characteristics, the role of sickness, driving away evil Yingxiang .
sentences.chinese: 少林宝剑富有传统的民族特色，具有驱邪迎祥之作用。

sentences.english: Fragrance of plum blossom is sweet in bitter cold.
sentences.chinese: 宝剑锋自磨砺出，梅花香自苦寒来。

sentences.english: One day, when he was crossing a river in a boat, ;
sentences.chinese: 一天，他坐船过江，不小心把宝剑掉到江中去了。

sentences.english: The sword was so deeply embedded in the rock that no one could move it.
sentences.chinese: 宝剑深深地嵌入岩石中，无人能搬得动。

definition: double-edged sword/CL:口[kou3],把[ba3]/classifier for blows of a sword
handle or shaft (of an axe etc)/(of a flower, leaf or fruit) stem/sth that affords an advantage to an opponent/classifier for knives or blades
halberd/long-handled weapon with pointed tip and crescent blade/combined spear and battle-ax
